topic.title: Release Notes for Couchbase Server 4.5 Beta

body.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 leaps forward with faster, simpler, and more secure data processing. Take a look at What's new? for a list of new features and improvements that are available in this Beta release. The Beta version of Couchbase Server 4.5 is intended for development purposes only. We consider Beta releases to have some rough edges and bugs, which might change before the final GA release. The Beta release is not supported in production.

This Beta release version of Couchbase Server 4.5 includes new features and behavior changes. The following sections list out the upgrade considerations, behavior changes, limitations, known issues, and deprecated items.

section.title: Upgrade
section.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 Beta requires a fresh install. Upgrading from an earlier version of Couchbase Server is not supported in the Beta release.

section.title: Behavior Changes
section.p: Here are the behavior changes in the product, compared to the previous release:

ul.li: Scientific notation for integers was disabled and large integers are no longer displayed in the scientific notation in N1QL. For example, large numbers will no longer be reported in the scientific format: "Column1": 9.223372036854776e+18. Instead, Couchbase Server will return "Column1": 9223372036854775807. Details for the change can be found in MB-14720.

PENDING index state is now represented as DEFERRED and BUILDING. With this change, global indexes no longer display a PENDING state under the status in SYSTEM:INDEXES. Instead, global indexes that are actively being built display BUILDING and global indexes that are created with the DEFER_BUILD option display DEFERRED for the status attribute in the SYSTEM:INDEXES output in N1QL. Details for the change can be found in MB-14679.

The new backup tool is called cbbackupmgr, and it is not backward compatible with older backup files from previous releases. If you want to take a backup of a previous release and then load and restore it in Couchbase Server 4.5, you should use the old cbbackup tool (not the new cbbackupmgr). After you restore the data into release 4.5, you can start using the cbbackupmgr for subsequent backup/restore operations to other Couchbase Server 4.5 nodes.

section.title: Limitations
section.p: Here are the limitations you will encounter when using Couchbase Server 4.5 Beta:

ul.li: FTS API support for Couchbase 4.5 Beta is available in Java 2.2.7 or greater, .net 2.2.8 or greater, Libcouchbase 2.6.0 or greater, golang 1.1.0 or greater, node.js 2.1.6 or greater, Python 2.0.9 or greater, and PHP 2.2 or greater.
MB-18285: There is no SSL support for full text searches.

Query monitoring and profiling information is available through N1QL and REST. Further, in current release it provides only node-local information. Monitoring information from all query nodes needs to be aggregated explicitly to obtain cluster-wide information.

Query tab in the Couchbase Web Console displays an error if query service is not installed or running on that node. The tab will show links to other nodes in the cluster that are running the query service.
Composite array Indexes on multiple attributes of the array elements is not supported. There is an enhancement request currently open for this MB-18128.

Memory Optimized Indexes is a cluster-wide setting and currently cannot coexist with other types of GSI indexes such as ForestDB. Memory Optimized Indexes must completely fit in memory. Mutations will not get propagated to the indexes in case of Out-of-memory errors.

During installation, you can choose between ForestDB or Memory Optimized Indexes to manage Global Secondary Indexes. On a single node, this setting cannot be changed post installation; to edit this setting, you would have to re-install Couchbase. Changing the optimization mode of global indexes is not supported when index service nodes are present in the cluster. Remove all index service nodes to change this option MB-18324.
Indexing on meta().type is not supported. (MB-18769)

Sub-document API support for Couchbase 4.5 BETA is available in Java 2.2.6 or greater, .net 2.2.7 or greater, Libcouchbase 2.5.3 or greater, golang 1.0.4 or greater, node.js 2.1.5 or greater, Python 2.0.9 or greater, PHP 2.2 or greater.
CBQ Engine does not support X.509 certificates.
Backup and Restore tool supports X.509 certificates in --no-verify mode without certificate verification.

section.title: Known Issues
section.p: This list covers some of the known problems with Couchbase Server 4.5 Beta. Please read this before reporting any new bugs, and watch for updates as new bugs are discovered.

row.entry: During the rebalance or swap rebalance, FTS queries may return fewer results than expected.
When indexing write mode is toggled from append only to circular and then back to append only, after few times compaction can fail with errors NO_DB_INSTANCE or CHECKSUM_ERROR.
When the compaction starting time is set to a non-zero value and the compaction end time is left at 00:00, compaction never starts with the circular writes mode for GSI.
An anonymous bucket user cannot query an FTS index alias even if the alias points to a bucket with no password.
When using memory-optimized indexes during a heavy write workload, the indexer process might abort.
On Windows, Memcached might drop the DCP connection and rebalance would fail.
FTS does not return some documents for a wild-card query
Indexer might fail to process and flush pending items to disk.

Restoring full text indexes will fail if restoring to a cluster where the index will be created for the first time. Workaround this issue by restoring to a cluster where the full text index already exists or skip restoring full text indexes with the --disable-ft-indexes flag.
In a multi-node configuration, the FTS stats appear only on the node to which you are currently connected and not on the remote nodes. However, full-text search is still performed on all nodes.
Indexes might crash during a long cluster run with a moderate to high write workload.
Rebalance of FTS indexes might fail under certain circumstances.
Projector process can consume a large amount of RAM.
FTS: Unable to create more than 10 indexes.
For some N1QL queries using GSI, forestDB commit time can range from 300ms to 10s.
Flush operation failed for the sample travel bucket.
Spatial views are broken after rebalance.

section.title: Deprecated Items
section.p: The following functionality is deprecated, will be deprecated or is unsupported.

row.entry: Function
Description

The BASE64() function is deprecated in this release; use the function BASE64_ENCODE() instead.
Also, use the BASE64_DECODE() function to reverse the encoding done by BASE64_ENCODE().
Server-side moxi proxy is deprecated in 4.5 BETA
Use Couchbase client SDKs or client-side moxi in your applications.
CRAM-MD5 for bucket authentication
Use SCRAM protocol supporting clients for bucket authentication in Watson. SCRAM protocol for bucket authentication will first be introduced in Java, followed by other SDK clients.
Deprecate XDCR API from /internalSettings REST endpoint in 4.5
/Settings/replications REST endpoint will be available for all replication settings and provides the same functionality.
N1QL: Deprecated the use of path-expressions in FROM and JOIN clauses.

FROM and JOIN clauses should use only keyspaces. Paths can be used for expressions in other clauses, operators, projections, and so on.
For example: SELECT count(*) FROM `travel-sample`.schedule; can be rewritten as: SELECT count(*) FROM `travel-sample` WHERE schedule IS NOT MISSING;
Couchbase Enterprise Backup and Restore tool

Starting with Version 4.5 Beta, the following commands are deprecated:
cbbackup
cbbackupwrapper
cbrestore
cbrestore wrapper
